alert.note: Alert for San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 26 at 6:57PM CDT until April 27 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, McCulloch and San Saba. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 656 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richland Springs, Algerita, Skeeterville, Placid, Rochelle, Hall, Us-190 Near The Mcculloch-San Saba County Line, Locker and Spring Creek. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1121 crossing Onion Creek, FM 1028 crossing Corn Creek, County Road 423 crossing Little Brady Creek, County Road 424 crossing Little Brady Creek, crossings along County Road 246, CR 340 crossing San Saba River, crossings along County Road 244 and CR 340 crossing Dry Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
